intro: Vincetoxicum augustinianum, commonly known as the black nightshade, is a perennial shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its dark purple to black berries, which are typically consumed by birds. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with a rough texture and can grow up to 2 meters in height. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Vincetoxicum augustinianum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and berries.
